Expectation2: Follow safety protocols to prevent accidents and injuries on site
Situation2: The carpenter should maintain a clean and organized work area
Story:
My phone buzzed in my pocket just as I was sweeping up sawdust in the workshop. I glanced at the screen and saw a message from Jamie, my best friend. The words stung: “I can’t believe you’d say that to me.” My heart dropped. I realized my last text must have come across all wrong. Jamie was clearly hurt, and I knew I should call right away to clear things up, just like we always promised to do—no letting misunderstandings fester.

But as I reached for my phone, I looked around at the scattered nails and wood scraps littering the floor. The foreman had just reminded us that a messy site was an accident waiting to happen, and I was already behind on cleanup. If I left it now, someone could trip or get hurt. My hands shook as I weighed the phone in one hand and the broom in the other, torn between being the friend Jamie needed and the responsible carpenter my crew depended on. The pressure built in my chest, and I stood frozen, caught between two worlds, unsure which to choose first.
